title: Style Properties
narrative:
This specification demonstrates how the `Style` type
    can be used to define how Swing components ought to be
    rendered.

features.id: Various kinds of String expressions can be parsed as colors by various style properties.

blocks.text: We use method chaining to build a colorful style:
code: var style = new ComponentStyleDelegate<>(new JPanel(), Style.none())

features.id: The String representation of a Style will tell you everything about it!

blocks.text: We first create a style with various properties:
code: var style = new ComponentStyleDelegate<>(new JPanel(), Style.none())
"family=Times New Roman, size=12, posture=0.0, weight=2.0, spacing=0.0, underlined=true, " +
